A4.text: St. Augustine is the oldest continuously occupied settlement of European origin in the contiguous United States.

A5.text: Founded in 1565 by the Spanish conquistador Pedro Menéndez de Avilés, St. Augustine is the oldest continuously occupied settlement of European origin in the contiguous United States.
